intro: Allium douglasii var. constrictum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved garlic. It is a perennial herb native to the western United States, particularly found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. Its bulbs are edible and have a mild garlic flavor, making it a valuable plant for both culinary and medicinal uses. The species is adapted to rocky soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
